page.title: 03Housing _ Silloth
page.content: Silloth town was built to a gridiron plan designed by architects J.W. & J. Hay of Liverpool.{ The Green}separates the shore {Promenade }from the town, which is based on 3 main streets parallel to the shore: {Criffel}St. {Solway}St. and {Skiddaw}St. The other streets are at right-angles and named after local rivers e.g.{Esk, Petteril, {Eden, Wampool, Waver, Caldew.}Most are wide and tree-lined, and some are cobbled with granite setts. In Silloth town itself there are two garages, 5 Churches, 5 licensed clubs, 5 hotels and pubs and 304 houses, some combined with the 35 shops. The houses are all ages, some back-to-back, but most with high - walled yards. The houses in the main streets are built in classical style and are mainly 3 stories high. A small new council estate was built in 1979.
